title: Ticket #1358: Make operations on invalid timers an EXCEPTion
description:
TimerManager currently allows attempts to CancelTimer or RemoveTimer an invalid timer id. It will complain "Timer %d not found" to the log, but who really notices. (See /src/condor_daemon_core.V6/timer_manager.cpp )

Generally speaking, attempting to manipulate an invalid timer is a symptom of a more serious bug. It's possible we take advantage of the ability to modify no-longer valid timers, but usually it's suspicious. That it's just a minor warning makes it easier for bugs to hide. #1337 is a serious bug in the kbdd that was hidden for several months, from 7.4.0 through 7.4.2 by this.

Proposed: Modify CancelTimer or RemoveTimer to EXCEPT on an invalid timer. This would have caught #1337 almost immediately. This will likely find other bugs that need to be fixed and it might find some places where we rely on this sketchy behavior, which will need to be changed.
